Characteristic: Re(E): Real part of Single-Electron Electric Field
Im(E): Imaginary part of Single-Electron Electric Field
MultiElectronIntegrationMethod: No approximation (use the standard 5D integration method)
Integrate numerically only over e-beam energy spread and use convolution to treat transverse emittance
SourceType: Electron Beam with Arbitrary Magnetic Field

title: Element Name
String
CRL
focalDistance: The value is for information purposes only and is valid for simple optical layout! For complicated beamlines (e.g., with SSA) the value may have some errors since it is calculated from the position of the source.
absoluteFocusPosition: The value is for information purposes only and is valid for simple optical layout! For complicated beamlines (e.g., with SSA) the value may have some errors since it is calculated from the position of the source.
wallThickness: Wall Thickness at Tip of Parabola [m]
tipWallThickness: Wall Thickness at Tip of Parabola [¬µm]

title: Element Name
String
Crystal
energy: Average photon energy the crystal should be oriented for [eV]

title: Element Name
String
Elliptical Cylinder Mirror
firstFocusLength: Distance from Source to Mirror Center (p) [m]
focalLength: Distance from Mirror Center to Second Focus (q) [m]

title: Element Name
String
Fiber
focalPlane: Horizontal (fiber is parallel to vertical axis), Vertical (fiber is parallel to horizontal axis)

photonEnergyPointCount: Number of Points vs Photon Energy
numberOfMacroElectrons: Number of macro-electrons for calculation of spectrum in case of arbitrary input magnetic field

photonEnergyPointCount: Number of Points vs Photon Energy
numberOfMacroElectrons: Number of macro-electrons for calculation of spectrum in case of arbitrary input magnetic field

photonEnergyPointCount: Number of Points vs Photon Energy

title: Element Name
String
Mask
horizontalGridDimension: Width and height for rectangular or elliptical grids

numberOfMacroElectrons: Number of macro-electrons (coherent wavefronts) for calculation of multi-electron wavefront propagation
calcCoherence: Calculate Degree of Coherence in addition to Intensity

horizontalPointCount: Number of Points vs Horizontal Position
verticalPointCount: Number of Points vs Vertical Position

2: Relative precision for propagation with auto-resizing
3:
Standard - Fresnel (it uses two FFTs)
Quadratic Term - with semi-analytical treatment of the quadratic (leading) phase terms (it uses two FFTs)
From Waist - good for propagation from "waist" over a large distance (it uses one FFT)
To Waist - good for propagation to a "waist" (e.g. some 2D focus of an optical system) over some distance (it uses one FFT)
4: Do any resizing on fourier side, using FFT
5: Horizontal range modification factor at resizing
6: Horizontal resolution modification factor at resizing
7: Vertical range modification factor at resizing
8: Vertical resolution modification factor at resizing
12:
Orientation of the Output Optical Axis vector in the Incident Beam Frame:
Horizontal Coordinate
13:
Orientation of the Output Optical Axis vector in the Incident Beam Frame:
Vertical Coordinate
14:
Orientation of the Output Optical Axis vector in the Incident Beam Frame:
Longitudinal Coordinate
15:
Orientation of the Horizontal Base vector of the Output Frame in the Incident Beam Frame:
Horizontal Coordinate
16:
Orientation of the Horizontal Base vector of the Output Frame in the Incident Beam Frame:
Vertical Coordinate

title: Element Name
String
Sample
rotateAngle: Positive values rotate the image counterclockwise, negative - clockwise
rotateReshape: If set to Yes, the output image is adapted so that the input image is contained completely in the output one
cutoffBackgroundNoise: The ratio for cutoff the background noise (between 0 and 1)
backgroundColor: The background color code to use instead of the background noise (0=black, 255=white)
tileImage: Tile the cut area of the image with the provided number of rows and columns

horizontalPointCount: Number of Points vs Horizontal Position
verticalPointCount: Number of Points vs Vertical Position

horizontalPointCount: Number of Points vs Horizontal Position
initialPosition: Initial Longitudinal Position for SR Calculation (effective if smaller than final position)
finalPosition: Final Longitudinal Position for SR Calculation (effective if larger than initial position)
verticalPointCount: Number of Points vs Vertical Position

initialTimeMoment: Initial Time Moment (c*t) for Electron Trajectory Calculation [m]
finalTimeMoment: Final Time Moment (c*t) for Electron Trajectory Calculation [m]
numberOfPoints: Number of Points for Trajectory Calculation

grating.title: Grating
advanced:
*Groove Density Polynomial:
$a_0 + a_1 y + a_2 y^2 + a_3 y^3 + a_4 y^4$
